isis.stitle: GENERAL INSTRUMENT ELECTRONIC PROGRAMMABLE SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER - TEST 5 - SENSOR GROUND AND CONTINUITY TEST (AT SENSOR)

svcproc.title: TEST 5 - SENSOR GROUND AND CONTINUITY TEST (AT SENSOR)
svcproc.para: This test would be performed if TEST 3 OR TEST 4 was not successful. This test checks "only the sensor unit" for isolation from ground and resistance of the sensor. Both the speedometer and tachometer sensors are tested in the same manner.

item.para: Turn switch key to OFF position.
This test requires the use of an ohmmeter.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 16 and Figure 17 for this test.

step1.para: Disconnect the sensor unit from the vehicle wire harness. Speedometer sensor is located in the rear of transmission and the engine speed sensor is located in the engine flywheel housing.

Set ohmmeter at HIGHEST scale. Connect one lead of meter to good vehicle ground. Test each sensor connector terminal to ground. Resistance at each terminal should be greater than 100,000 ohms. If resistance IS NOT GREATER than 100,000 ohms replace and adjust the sensor unit. Rerun Step 2 to verify correction and perform step 3. If resistance is greater than 100,000 ohms perform Step 3.

Set ohmmeter to Rx1 scale. Test resistance from one sensor unit connector terminal to the other. Resistance should be (see sensor resistance chart) ohms. If sensor resistance IS NOT (see SENSOR RESISTANCE CHART) ohms replace and adjust the sensor. Return to Step 2 and rerun to verify. When verified go to TEST 6.
If TEST 5 is successful go to TEST 6.

Repeat TEST 3. If after repeating TEST 3 the resistance to ground IS LESS than 100,000 ohms OR sensor resistance IS NOT (see SENSOR RESISTANCE CHART) ohms correct defect in vehicle wire harness between sensor unit and instrument panel connector. If TEST 3 is successful go to Test 6.
